tickets.title: Finalize and document luxury color palette
tickets.description:
## Overview

Establish the foundational color palette for the luxury redesign. This palette will be used across all components and pages, so it must be carefully chosen for elegance, accessibility, and consistency.

## Types

```typescript
// Color palette structure
interface ColorPalette {
  primaryNeutral: string;    // #F8F8F8 - Soft white backgrounds
  secondaryNeutral: string;  // #2C2C2C - Deep charcoal for text
  accentGold: string;        // #D4AF37 - Luxe gold accents
  sage: string;              // #A8B8A8 - Calming sage green
  taupe: string;             // #A99680 - Warm taupe
  borderSubtle: string;      // #E5E5E5 - Soft borders
}
```

## Implementation Guide

### Step 1: Create color CSS file

**Files:** `src/styles/colors.css`

```css
/* src/styles/colors.css */
:root {
  --color-primary-neutral: #F8F8F8;
  --color-secondary-neutral: #2C2C2C;
  --color-accent-gold: #D4AF37;
  --color-sage: #A8B8A8;
  --color-taupe: #A99680;
  --color-border-subtle: #E5E5E5;
}
```

### Step 2: Test contrast ratios

Use WebAIM contrast checker or similar tool to verify:
- Body text (#2C2C2C on #F8F8F8): Must be ≥ 4.5:1
- Large text: Must be ≥ 3:1
- All accent colors against backgrounds

### Step 3: Document usage guidelines

Create a comment block or separate doc showing:
- When to use each color
- Which combinations are accessible
- Brand personality each color conveys

## Acceptance Criteria

- [ ] All 6 colors defined and tested for accessibility
- [ ] Contrast ratios meet WCAG AA standards
- [ ] CSS variables created in `src/styles/colors.css`
- [ ] Color usage guide documented
- [ ] Design system file shows examples

## References

- WCAG 2.1 Contrast Guidelines: https://www.w3.org/WAI/WCAG21/Understanding/contrast-minimum.html
- WebAIM Contrast Checker: https://webaim.org/resources/contrastchecker/

tickets.title: Redesign swipe card with elegant frame and image treatment
tickets.description:
## Overview

The swipe card is the centerpiece of discovery. It needs to feel premium with elegant framing, proper spacing, and refined shadows.

## Implementation Guide

### Step 1: Update card structure

**Files:** `src/pages/DiscoverPage.jsx`

- Use Card component from Epic 2
- Apply refined shadow (--shadow-md)
- Border radius 12px
- Elegant padding around edges

### Step 2: Optimize image display

- Image should be object-fit: cover
- Maintain aspect ratio (4:3 or 1:1)
- No stretching or distortion
- Add subtle border or frame effect

### Step 3: Responsive sizing

- Mobile: ~70vh height, ~90% width
- Desktop: Max-width 400px, centered

## Design Details

Mobile: ~70vh height, ~90% width with 16px padding on sides
Desktop: Max-width 400px, centered on screen
Image: Object-fit: cover, maintain aspect ratio

## Acceptance Criteria

- [ ] Card uses refined Card component
- [ ] Image has elegant frame/border
- [ ] Subtle shadow applied using tokens
- [ ] Padding optimized for mobile and desktop
- [ ] Border radius consistent (12px)
- [ ] Image loads properly, no stretching

## References

- Depends on: Ticket 2.2 (Card component)
- Related file: `src/pages/DiscoverPage.jsx`

tickets.title: Enhance swipe animations
tickets.description:
## Overview

Swipe animations should feel smooth and refined, not bouncy or cartoonish. 60fps performance is essential.

## Implementation Guide

### Step 1: Refine spring physics

If using react-spring or similar:
- Reduce bounce
- Smooth easing
- Exit animation matches swipe direction

### Step 2: Optimize performance

- Use transform and opacity (GPU accelerated)
- Avoid layout properties (width, height, top, left)
- Test on mid-range devices

## Acceptance Criteria

- [ ] Swipe animations smooth at 60fps
- [ ] Spring physics feel refined (not bouncy)
- [ ] Exit animation matches direction
- [ ] Landing state transitions smoothly
- [ ] No jank or stuttering

tickets.title: Perform accessibility audit (WCAG 2.1 AA)
tickets.description:
## Overview

Ensure the app meets WCAG 2.1 AA accessibility standards.

## Acceptance Criteria

- [ ] Color contrast ratios verified (4.5:1 for body, 3:1 for large)
- [ ] Keyboard navigation tested (Tab, Shift+Tab, Enter, Escape)
- [ ] Screen reader tested (VoiceOver, NVDA, or similar)
- [ ] Focus states visible and clear
- [ ] ARIA labels where needed
- [ ] No keyboard traps
- [ ] Form labels associated with inputs
- [ ] Audit tool passes (axe, Lighthouse, etc.)

## References

- WCAG 2.1 Guidelines: https://www.w3.org/WAI/WCAG21/quickref/

tickets.title: Optimize performance metrics

## Acceptance Criteria

- [ ] First Contentful Paint < 1.5 seconds
- [ ] CSS minified and optimized
- [ ] Images optimized (compressed, lazy-loaded)
- [ ] No layout shift (Cumulative Layout Shift < 0.1)
- [ ] Lighthouse score > 90

tickets.title: Test cross-browser compatibility

## Acceptance Criteria

- [ ] Safari: rendering consistent
- [ ] Edge: rendering consistent
- [ ] Mobile browsers tested
- [ ] No critical bugs on any browser
